title: Rule of law in UK vs. rule by law in Russia

content.question: Which of the following accurately explains an outcome of differing judicial systems among the Comparative Government course countries?

choices.label: The British judiciary uses common law to enforce rule of law, whereas the Russian judiciary uses the judiciary to target opposition.
The Chinese judiciary uses rule of law, whereas the Russian judiciary gets its power from judicial review.
The Nigerian judiciary is dominated by Sharia law, whereas the Mexican judiciary practices rule of law.
The Russian judiciary supports rule of law, whereas the Iranian judiciary is governed by Sharia law.

content.answer: The British judiciary uses common law to enforce rule of law, whereas the Russian judiciary uses the judiciary to target opposition.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
